current_contact.agency: New Hampshire State Med Exams Ofc

case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Near complete or complete skeleton
case_circumstances: On November 10, 1985 the skeletal remains of an adult female and one female child were located in Allenstown, NH. On May 9, 2000 the skeletal remains of two additional female children were recovered. The adult female was between 23-33 years old. The three children were young, all under 11 years old. DNA testing confirmed that two of the children were maternally related to the adult female. All four victims may be biologically linked, but DNA results are still pending. It is estimated that they died in the early 1980â€™s. See NamUs profiles 2173, 2175, and 2176 for detailed information on the other victims related to this adult.
case_head_hair: Light brown, wavy hair approximately 4 inched in length
